title: Functions on ordinals; strictly monotone ordinal functions

blocks.name: iunon
blocks.content: The indexed union of a set of ordinal numbers ` B ( x ) ` is an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunon(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, con0))), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c2), con0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(ciun(s0, c0, c2), con0, cuni(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, con0))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, con0)), wceq(ciun(s0, c0, c2), cuni(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)))))
  dfiun3g(s0, c0, c2, con0)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, con0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2))), con0), wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), universe), wss(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), con0))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), universe), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), universe))
  mptexg(s0, c0, c1, c2)
  rnexg(cmpt(s0, c0, c2), universe)
  rnmptss(s0, c0, c2, con0, cmpt(s0, c0, c2))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c2))
  imp(wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), universe), wss(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), con0), wcel(cuni(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2))), con0))
  ssonuni(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c2)), universe)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iunon(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà On))‚Üí ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2)‚àà On)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2), con0, ‚ãÉ ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2)), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà On)))
  adantl(c0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà On), ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2)= ‚ãÉ ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2)))
  dfiun3g(s0, c0, c2, con0)
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà On), ‚ãÉ ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚àà On, ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚àà ùïå, ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚äÜ On)
  syl(c0 ‚àà c1, ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚àà ùïå, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2)‚àà ùïå)
  mptexg(s0, c0, c1, c2)
  rnexg((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2), universe)
  rnmptss(s0, c0, c2, con0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))
  eqid((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))
  imp(ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚àà ùïå, ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚äÜ On, ‚ãÉ ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2))‚àà On)
  ssonuni(ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2)), universe)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: iinon
blocks.content: The nonempty indexed intersection of a class of ordinal numbers ` B ( x ) ` is an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm iinon(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wne(c0, emptycls)), wcel(ciin(s0, c0, c1), con0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(ciin(s0, c0, c1), con0, cint(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))), wa(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wne(c0, emptycls)))
  adantr(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wne(c0, emptycls), wceq(ciin(s0, c0, c1), cint(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))))
  dfiin3g(s0, c0, c1, con0)
  syl2an2r(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cint(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))), con0), wss(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), con0), wne(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls))
  rnmptss(s0, c0, c1, con0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  biimpar(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls))
  necon3bid(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls, c0, emptycls, wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)))
  syl5bbr(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)), wceq(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls))
  dm0rn0(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  eqeq1d(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), emptycls, c0, wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, con0)))
  dmmptg(s0, c0, c1, con0)
  oninton(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

thm iinon(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

  rnmptss(s0, c0, c1, con0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))

  biimpar(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà On), c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))‚â† ‚àÖ)
  necon3bid(ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1)), emptycls, c0, emptycls, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà On))
  syl5bbr(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà On), ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))= ‚àÖ, c0 = ‚àÖ, dom((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))= ‚àÖ)
  dm0rn0((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))

  dmmptg(s0, c0, c1, con0)
  oninton(ran((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1)))
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: onfununi
blocks.content: A property of functions on ordinal numbers. Generalization of Theorem Schema 8E of [Enderton] p. 218. (Contributed by Eric Schmidt, 26-May-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm onfununi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)), wceq(cfv(c2, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(wlim(cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s1)), ciun(s0, cv(s1), cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), con0), wcel(cv(s1), con0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wss(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  eqssd(cfv(c2, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)))
  pm2.61d2(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)), wss(cfv(c2, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wcel(cuni(c0), c0))
  ex(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)), wn(wcel(cuni(c0), c0)), wss(cfv(c2, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))

  mpd(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)), wn(wcel(cuni(c0), c0))), wceq(cfv(c2, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, cuni(c0), cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wlim(cuni(c0)))

  ad2antrr(wss(c0, con0), wn(wcel(cuni(c0), c0)), wne(c0, emptycls), word(cuni(c0)))
  sylan(wa(wss(c0, con0), wn(wcel(cuni(c0), c0))), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(cuni(c0), emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0)))

  imp(wss(c0, con0), wn(wcel(cuni(c0), c0)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cuni(c0))))

  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls), wss(ciun(s0, cuni(c0), cfv(c2, cv(s0))), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))

thm onovuni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wne(c0, emptycls)), wceq(co(c2, c3, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, co(c2, c3, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(wlim(cv(s1)), wceq(co(c2, c3, cv(s1)), ciun(s0, cv(s1), co(c2, c3, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), con0), wcel(cv(s1), con0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wss(co(c2, c3, cv(s0)), co(c2, c3, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)

blocks.content: A variant of ~ onovuni with indexed unions. (Contributed by Eric Schmidt, 26-May-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: onnseq
blocks.content: There are no length ` _om ` decreasing sequences in the ordinals. See also ~ noinfep for a stronger version assuming Regularity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-May-2015.)

blocks.name: wsmo
blocks.content: Introduce the strictly monotone ordinal function. A strictly monotone function is one that is constantly increasing across the ordinals.
blocks.origin: prop wff wsmo(class c0) { Smo(c0) }

blocks.name: diff.wsmo.s
diff.wsmo.c
diff.wsmo.w
df-smo
blocks.content: Definition of a strictly monotone ordinal function. Definition 7.46 in [TakeutiZaring] p. 50. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 15-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: dfsmo2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of a strictly monotone ordinal function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Mar-2013.)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

} = {

blocks.name: issmo
blocks.content: Conditions for which ` A ` is a strictly monotone ordinal function. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 15-Nov-2011.) Avoid ~ ax-13 . (Revised by Gino Giotto, 19-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm issmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wsmo(c0)
  -| wf(c0, c1, con0)
  -| word(c1)
  -| wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))
  -| wceq(cdm(c0), c1)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpbir3an(wsmo(c0), wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0), word(cdm(c0)), wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, cdm(c0), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))))
  mpbir(wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0), wf(c0, c1, con0))
  feq2i(c0, cdm(c0), con0, c1)
  mpbir(word(cdm(c0)), word(c1))
  ax-mp(wb(word(cdm(c0)), word(c1)), wceq(cdm(c0), c1))
  ordeq(cdm(c0), c1)
  rgen2(s0, s1, cdm(c0), cdm(c0), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))
  syl2anb(wcel(cv(s0), cdm(c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cdm(c0)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  eleq2i(cv(s0), cdm(c0), c1)
  eleq2i(cv(s1), cdm(c0), c1)
  df-smo(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm issmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ Smo(c0)
  ‚ä£ (c0 : c1 ‚Üí On)
  ‚ä£ Ord(c1)
  ‚ä£ ((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(s0 ‚àà s1 ‚Üí(c0 ` s0)‚àà(c0 ` s1)))
  ‚ä£ dom(c0)= c1
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpbir3an(Smo(c0), (c0 : dom(c0)‚Üí On), Ord(dom(c0)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),(s0 ‚àà s1 ‚Üí(c0 ` s0)‚àà(c0 ` s1)))))
  mpbir((c0 : dom(c0)‚Üí On), (c0 : c1 ‚Üí On))
  feq2i(c0, dom(c0), con0, c1)
  mpbir(Ord(dom(c0)), Ord(c1))
  ax-mp((Ord(dom(c0))‚Üî Ord(c1)), dom(c0)= c1)
  ordeq(dom(c0), c1)
  rgen2(s0, s1, dom(c0), dom(c0), (s0 ‚àà s1 ‚Üí(c0 ` s0)‚àà(c0 ` s1)))
  syl2anb(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), s1 ‚àà dom(c0), (s0 ‚àà s1 ‚Üí(c0 ` s0)‚àà(c0 ` s1)), s0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1)
  eleq2i(s0, dom(c0), c1)
  eleq2i(s1, dom(c0), c1)
  df-smo(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c0)
}

blocks.content: Alternate definition of a strictly monotone ordinal function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm issmo2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wf(c0, c1, c2), wi(w3a(wss(c2, con0), word(c1), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))), wsmo(c0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl6ibr(wf(c0, c1, c2), w3a(wss(c2, con0), word(c1), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))), wsmo(c0), w3a(wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0), word(cdm(c0)), wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))
  3anim123d(wf(c0, c1, c2), wss(c2, con0), word(c1), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))), wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0), word(cdm(c0)), wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))
  sylibrd(wf(c0, c1, c2), wss(c2, con0), wf(c0, cdm(c0), con0), wf(c0, c1, con0))
  ex(wf(c0, c1, c2), wss(c2, con0), wf(c0, c1, con0))
  fss(c0, c1, c2, con0)
  feq2d(c0, cdm(c0), con0, c1, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  biimprd(wf(c0, c1, c2), word(c1), word(cdm(c0)))
  syl(wf(c0, c1, c2), wb(word(cdm(c0)), word(c1)), wceq(cdm(c0), c1))
  ordeq(cdm(c0), c1)
  biimprd(wf(c0, c1, c2), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))), wral(s0, cdm(c0), wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))
  raleqdv(s0, cdm(c0), c1, wf(c0, c1, c2), wral(s1, cv(s0), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))
  fdm(c0, c1, c2)
  dfsmo2(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c0)
}

  ex((c0 : c1 ‚Üí c2), c2 ‚äÜ On, (c0 : c1 ‚Üí On))
  fss(c0, c1, c2, con0)

blocks.name: smodm
blocks.content: The domain of a strictly monotone function is an ordinal. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 16-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: smores
blocks.content: A strictly monotone function restricted to an ordinal remains strictly monotone. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 16-Nov-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: smo0
blocks.content: The null set is a strictly monotone ordinal function. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 20-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: smofvon
blocks.content: If ` B ` is a strictly monotone ordinal function, and ` A ` is in the domain of ` B ` , then the value of the function at ` A ` is an ordinal. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 20-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: smoel

blocks.name: smoel2
blocks.content: A strictly monotone ordinal function preserves the membership relation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: smo11
blocks.content: A strictly monotone ordinal function is one-to-one. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: smoword
blocks.content: A strictly monotone ordinal function preserves weak ordering. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Mar-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm smoword(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), wb(wss(c2, c3), wss(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c3))))
} = {
  3bitr4d(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), wss(c2, c3), wss(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), wn(wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wcel(cfv(c0, c3), cfv(c0, c2))))
  ancom2s(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1), wb(wn(wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wcel(cfv(c0, c3), cfv(c0, c2)))))
  notbid(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c3, c1), wcel(c2, c1))), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cfv(c0, c3), cfv(c0, c2)))
  smoord(c0, c1, c3, c2)
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), wb(wss(c2, c3), wn(wcel(c3, c2))), word(c2), word(c3))
  syl2an2r(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1)), word(c2), word(c1), wcel(c2, c1))
  simprl(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))
  ordelord(c1, c2)
  syl2an2r(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1)), word(c3), word(c1), wcel(c3, c1))
  smodm2(c0, c1)
  simprr(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))
  ordelord(c1, c3)
  ordtri1(c2, c3)
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), wb(wss(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), wn(wcel(cfv(c0, c3), cfv(c0, c2)))), word(cfv(c0, c2)), word(cfv(c0, c3)))
  3syl(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), word(cfv(c0, c2)), wsmo(c0), wcel(cfv(c0, c2), con0))
  smofvon2(c0, c2)
  eloni(cfv(c0, c2))
  3syl(wa(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), word(cfv(c0, c3)), wsmo(c0), wcel(cfv(c0, c3), con0))
  simplr(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1)))
  smofvon2(c0, c3)
  eloni(cfv(c0, c3))
  ordtri1(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c3))
}

  3syl(((c0[Fn]c1 ‚àß Smo(c0))‚àß(c2 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c1)), Ord((c0 ` c2)), Smo(c0), (c0 ` c2)‚àà On)
  smofvon2(c0, c2)
  eloni((c0 ` c2))
  3syl(((c0[Fn]c1 ‚àß Smo(c0))‚àß(c2 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c1)), Ord((c0 ` c3)), Smo(c0), (c0 ` c3)‚àà On)
  simplr(c0[Fn]c1, Smo(c0), (c2 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c1))

blocks.name: smogt
blocks.content: A strictly monotone ordinal function is greater than or equal to its argument. Exercise 1 in [TakeutiZaring] p. 50. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 23-Nov-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm smogt(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(c2, c1)), wss(c2, cfv(c0, c2)))

  3impia(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(c2, c1), wss(c2, cfv(c0, c2)))
  com12(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wcel(c2, c1), wss(c2, cfv(c0, c2)))
  vtoclga(hs0, c2, c1, wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wss(c2, cfv(c0, c2))), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), wss(c2, cfv(c0, c2)))

  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c2))

  3expia(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))
  mpcom(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0))
  sylibr(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs0)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), word(cv(hs0)), word(c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  elon(cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  tfis2(hs0, hs1, wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wss(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wss(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))
  3anbi3d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  eleq1w(hs0, hs1, c1)
  sseq12d(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c0)
  a1i(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wi(wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wss(cv(hs1), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))), wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))

blocks.content: The range of a strictly monotone ordinal function dominates the domain. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Mar-2013.)

thm smorndom(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  sylancom(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), word(cv(hs0)), word(c1))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), word(c1), wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0))

  ordelord(c1, cv(hs0))
  simpl3(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), wfn(c0, c1), wsmo(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  ffnd(c0, c1, c2, wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  simpl1(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  simpl2(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  simpr(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wsmo(c0), word(c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
